page.title: 04FORESTRY.
page.content: A considerable area of the map extract has been forested by the {Forestry {Commission,}especially the steep, north-facing slope on the south side of the river - an area with less insolation than the northern part of the map. North of the river the forestry is a mixture of Forestry Commission plantings and {estate woodland.} These commercial woodlands are of the more rapidly growing conifers. Cairnton House and Inchmarlo house retain deciduous {amenity woodland around them. The extreme north-west of the map has poor quality silver birch {scrub woodland in fields used for cattle grazing on the rough pasture interspersed with the birches.
